greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = prime(p)^e.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization (first 1000 terms from Harry J. Smith)
formula: For n = p_{i1} * p_{i2} * ... * p_{ik}, where the indices i1, i2, ..., ik of primes p are not necessarily distinct, a(n) = A006450(i1) * A006450(i2) * ... * A006450(ik).
A046523(a(n)) = A046523(n). [Preserves the prime signature of n].
mathematica: Table[If[n == 1, 1, Apply[Times, FactorInteger[n] /. {p_, e_} /; p > 1 :> Prime[p]^e]], {n, 58}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 22 2017 *)
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, f=factor(n)~; a=1; for (i=1, length(f), a*=prime(f[1, i])^f[2, i]); write("b064988.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 02 2009
(PARI) a(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, f[k, 1] = prime(f[k, 1]);); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 08 2017
def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [prime(p)**e for p, e in factorint(n).items()])
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Aug 08 2017
xref: Cf. A076610 (terms sorted into ascending order).
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 30 2001
